授業目的: The primary goal of this course is to provide students with a conceptual framework for identifying and resolving accounting issues faced by managers. The secondary purpose of this course is to help increase students’ quantitative skill by dealing with several exercises and problems on the classification of cost, CVP analysis, accumulating and assessing costs to products, measuring and managing customer relationships and process performance, budgets for planning and coordination, and financial control.
到達目標: After the completion of the course, students will be able to use accounting information for decision-making, performance evaluation, and control. Besides, they will learn some behavioral and organizational issues in management accounting and control system.The course is useful for the students who intend to work as management consultants or management accountants of manufacturing companies.
授業方法: Students need to pre-apply for the course during 4/1～4/3 on Kyogaku web. For those who applied to take courses on-line, I will conduct real-time zoom sessions during course hours. Course pedagogy includes lectures on topics followed by case studies to illustrate and reinforce concepts. Students are expected to have read and prepped, within groups, the assigned problem prior to attending the face-to-face class. The textbook will be used to pick up the conceptual tools to prep for each case. The instructor will supply all the reading materials in advance. 第1回: Introduction and overview of the course- the distinction between management accounting and financial accounting-behavioral implications of management accounting information
第2回: The Balanced Scorecard and strategy map-financial, customer, process, learning and growth perspectives of a balanced scorecard- barriers to implementing balance scorecard
第3回: Costs in decision making -variable, semi-variable, and fixed cost- incremental cost, relevant cost, and sunk costs-opportunity cost, manufacturing cost, and avoidable costs
第4回: Cost-volume-profit analysis- contribution margin- break-even point- margin of safety- shutdown point-pricing
第5回: Uncertainty into cost-volume-profit analysis-what if analysis
第6回: Accumulating and assigning costs to products -cost object- direct and indirect costs- cost pool
第7回: Accumulating and assigning costs to products - cost object- direct and indirect costs- cost pool
第8回: Job order costing- determination of overhead allocation base
第10回: Activity- based costing- determination of overhead allocation base
第11回: Measuring customer profitability -building a whale curve of customer- customers life-cycle profitability
第12回: Measuring process performance - JIT- Kaizen costing.
第13回: Budgeting process- operating and financial budget- master budget- static and flexible budget
